intro: Forsteronia foliosa, commonly known as the leafy forsteria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Forsteronia foliosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
